authors: Ashleigh Davis For Daily Mail Australia
description: A Perth man has been filmed confronting an alleged thief who he claims stole his bicycle. Footage shows the man outside an IGA grocery store demanding the alleged thief's name.
title: Man films himself retrieving his stolen bike back off kid
title_page: Man films himself retrieving his stolen bike back off kidÂ  | Daily Mail Online
text:
A heavily-tattooed man who says his bicycle was stolen films the moment he grabs a young rider by the neck retrieve it.
The footage, which was uploaded to Facebook, shows the Perth man holding the arm of a young man outside an IGA store who is wearing a blue bicycle helmet.
The man is heard saying: 'Are you filming this?' and then asks the boy what his name is while he has hold of his arm so he can't escape.
Scroll down for video
A Perth man who had his bicycle stolen has been filmed confronting the alleged thief and claiming his bicycle back
The boy answers with his first name and then has to be prompted by the man to reveal his surname as well.
The man, who at this point has grabbed him by the back of his shirt, then pushes him away and says to him 'Get the f*** out of here.'
He is then seen wheeling his recovered bicycle away.
In a comment under the video the man wrote: 'My bike got stolen this morning and it's disappointing to know there are people out there just to cause trouble... but on the flip side it's amazing to know there are so many amazing people out there helping each other out'.
